content.title: Thoracic Spine Access (Transthoracic Approach)
content.definition: Surgical exposure of the anterior thoracic spine (T4-T12) through thoracotomy or thoracoscopic approaches, requiring management of thoracic aorta and intercostal vessels.

key_concepts.description: Open lateral thoracotomy providing direct visualization. Right-sided for upper thoracic, left-sided for T6-T12 (avoids liver).
Minimally invasive video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery. Reduced morbidity but limited working space.
Intercostal arteries arise from thoracic aorta. Must be ligated at operative levels. Risk of spinal cord ischemia if multiple levels sacrificed.
Major anterior spinal artery feeder, typically T9-L2 on left. Critical to identify preoperatively on CTA/MRA if extensive segmental vessel ligation planned.

technique.positioning: Lateral decubitus with appropriate side up based on approach
vascular_steps: Identify and ligate segmental (intercostal) vessels at operative levels
Mobilize thoracic aorta if crossing midline needed
Double ligate segmental vessels - clips and ties
Limit segmental vessel sacrifice to 2-3 consecutive levels when possible
technique.lung_management: Single-lung ventilation with double-lumen endotracheal tube

arterial.spinal_cord_protection: Limit consecutive segmental vessel ligation, consider spinal cord monitoring, staged procedures if extensive

venous.management: Can be ligated more freely than arterial structures

vascular.aortic_injury: Rare but catastrophic. Control with digital pressure, primary repair.
vascular.spinal_cord_ischemia: 1-5% risk with extensive segmental vessel ligation

content.statement: Thoracic Spine Access (Transthoracic Approach) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Spine-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Thoracic Spine Access (Transthoracic Approach).

citations: Shen FH, et al. Thoracic spine access: anterior approach. J Am Acad Orthop Surg. 2009;17(5):324-333

learning_objectives: Describe the approach selection for different thoracic spine levels
Explain the significance of the artery of Adamkiewicz
Discuss strategies for spinal cord protection during thoracic spine access
clinical_pearls: Preoperative CTA to identify artery of Adamkiewicz location
Left-sided approach for lower thoracic spine
Limit consecutive segmental vessel ligation to minimize spinal cord ischemia risk
